description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

allOf.description: Represents a request for a patient to employ a medical device. The device may be an implantable device, or an external assistive device, such as a walker.

identifier.description: Identifiers assigned to this order by the orderer or by the receiver.

definition.description: Protocol or definition followed by this request. For example: The proposed act must be performed if the indicated conditions occur, e.g.., shortness of breath, SpO2 less than x%.

replaces.description: The request takes the place of the referenced completed or terminated request(s).

requisition.description: Composite request this is part of.

stage.description: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, an original order or a reflex order.

deviceReference.description: The details of the device to be used.

deviceCodeableConcept.description: The details of the device to be used.

subject.description: The patient who will use the device.

context.description: An encounter that provides additional context in which this request is made.

occurrenceDateTime.description: The timing schedule for the use of the device. The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example. "Every 8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:"; "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013".

occurrencePeriod.description: The timing schedule for the use of the device. The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example. "Every 8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:"; "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013".

occurrenceTiming.description: The timing schedule for the use of the device. The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example. "Every 8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:"; "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013".

authored.description: When the request transitioned to being actionable.

requester.description: Who/what is requesting diagnostics.  The practitioner that holds legal responsibility for ordering the investigation.

performerType.description: Desired type of performer for doing the diagnostic testing.

performer.description: The desired perfomer for doing the diagnostic testing.

reasonCode.description: Reason or justification for the use of this device.

reasonReference.description: Reason or justification for the use of this device.

supportingInfo.description: Additional clinical information about the patient that may influence the request fulfilment.  For example, this may includes body where on the subject's the device will be used ( i.e. the target site).

note.description: Details about this request that were not represented at all or sufficiently in one of the attributes provided in a class. These may include for example a comment, an instruction, or a note associated with the statement.

relevantHistory.description: Key events in the history of the request.
